name: Pope Alexander IV
summary: Alexander IV, born Rinaldo di Jenne, was Pope from 1254 to 1261. He was a nephew of Pope Gregory IX. He continued the policies of his predecessors regarding the Hohenstaufen dynasty. He canonized St. Clare of Assisi and worked to support the Franciscan order. He attempted to organize a crusade but was unsuccessful. His pontificate occurred during a period of conflict between the papacy and the Holy Roman Empire, continuing the struggle that had begun under Innocent IV.
